SEARCH
Package com.example.haboob

Class MockFirebaseTests

java.lang.Object
com.example.haboob.MockFirebaseTests
public class MockFirebaseTests extends Object
Unit tests using Mockito to verify Firestore behavior WITHOUT touching the real network or the Firebase emulator. These tests run on the JVM (src/test/java).

    MockFirebaseTests()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addEvent_callsSetOnCorrectDocument()
    Ensures that when addFakeEvent() is called, - the repo calls events/ - and writes the Event object to Firestore.
    void
    addEvent_callsSetThenRegistersListener_inOrder()
    Confirms that the repository: 1) calls doc.set(event) 2) then registers the completion listener on the returned Task.
    void
    addEvent_handlesEmptyEvent()
    Ensures that the repository does not crash when writing an empty Event object.
    void
    addEvent_invokesCompletionCallback()
    Ensures that the completion callback is triggered once set() is called.
    void
    addEvent_multipleEventsWriteToSeparateDocuments()
    Ensures that multiple calls to addfakeEvent() write each event to its own Firestore document using the correct IDs.
    void
    addEvent_passesSameTaskInstanceToCallback()
    Ensures that the Task passed into the completion callback is exactly the same Task instance returned by mockDoc.set().
    void
    addEvent_registersOnCompleteListenerOnTask()
    Ensures that addfakeEvent() registers an OnCompleteListener on the Task returned from mockDoc.set().
    void
    addEvent_savesEnrolledEntrantsList()
    Ensures that enrolledEntrants list is saved correctly when creating a new fake event.
    void
    addEvent_targetsCorrectCollection()
    Makes sure the repo writes to "events" collection, never any other path.
    void
    addEvent_withPopulatedLists_stillInvokesCallback()
    Ensures that even when the Event has various lists populated (e.g., enrolled entrants), the completion callback is still invoked.
    void
    setup()

  • Method Details

    • setup

      public void setup()

    • addEvent_callsSetOnCorrectDocument

      public void addEvent_callsSetOnCorrectDocument()
      Ensures that when addFakeEvent() is called, - the repo calls events/ - and writes the Event object to Firestore.

    • addEvent_savesEnrolledEntrantsList

      public void addEvent_savesEnrolledEntrantsList()
      Ensures that enrolledEntrants list is saved correctly when creating a new fake event.

    • addEvent_handlesEmptyEvent

      public void addEvent_handlesEmptyEvent()
      Ensures that the repository does not crash when writing an empty Event object.

    • addEvent_targetsCorrectCollection

      public void addEvent_targetsCorrectCollection()
      Makes sure the repo writes to "events" collection, never any other path.

    • addEvent_invokesCompletionCallback

      public void addEvent_invokesCompletionCallback()
      Ensures that the completion callback is triggered once set() is called.

    • addEvent_registersOnCompleteListenerOnTask

      public void addEvent_registersOnCompleteListenerOnTask()
      Ensures that addfakeEvent() registers an OnCompleteListener on the Task returned from mockDoc.set().

    • addEvent_callsSetThenRegistersListener_inOrder

      public void addEvent_callsSetThenRegistersListener_inOrder()
      Confirms that the repository: 1) calls doc.set(event) 2) then registers the completion listener on the returned Task. This guards against subtle bugs where a listener might be attached to the wrong Task instance or in the wrong order.

    • addEvent_passesSameTaskInstanceToCallback

      public void addEvent_passesSameTaskInstanceToCallback()
      Ensures that the Task passed into the completion callback is exactly the same Task instance returned by mockDoc.set().

    • addEvent_multipleEventsWriteToSeparateDocuments

      public void addEvent_multipleEventsWriteToSeparateDocuments()
      Ensures that multiple calls to addfakeEvent() write each event to its own Firestore document using the correct IDs.

    • addEvent_withPopulatedLists_stillInvokesCallback

      public void addEvent_withPopulatedLists_stillInvokesCallback()
      Ensures that even when the Event has various lists populated (e.g., enrolled entrants), the completion callback is still invoked.
